simulatedInstall.description: Simulate the initial runtime detection and installation flow for testing and debugging purposes.

tools.title: Internal Tools
tools.selectTool: Select a tool to view details

read.description: Read file contents from the filesystem
read.details:
## Read Tool

Read files from the local filesystem with support for various file types.

### Capabilities
- Read text files with line numbers
- Read images (PNG, JPG, etc.) - presented visually
- Read PDF files with page range selection
- Read Jupyter notebooks (.ipynb) with all cells and outputs
- Supports offset and limit for large files

### Parameters
- `file_path` (required): Absolute path to the file
- `offset`: Line number to start reading from
- `limit`: Number of lines to read
- `pages`: Page range for PDF files (e.g., "1-5")

### Notes
- Line numbers start at 1
- Lines longer than 2000 characters are truncated
- For PDFs larger than 10 pages, use the `pages` parameter

write.description: Write content to files on the filesystem
write.details:
## Write Tool

Write or overwrite files on the local filesystem.

### Capabilities
- Create new files
- Overwrite existing files
- Works with any text-based file format

### Parameters
- `file_path` (required): Absolute path to the file
- `content` (required): Content to write to the file

### Notes
- Will overwrite existing files without warning
- Requires reading the file first if it exists
- Creates parent directories if they don't exist

edit.description: Perform exact string replacements in files
edit.details:
## Edit Tool

Perform exact string replacements in files.

### Capabilities
- Replace specific text in files
- Preserve exact indentation
- Replace all occurrences with `replace_all`

### Parameters
- `file_path` (required): Absolute path to the file
- `old_string` (required): Text to replace
- `new_string` (required): Replacement text
- `replace_all`: Replace all occurrences (default: false)

### Notes
- Edit will fail if `old_string` is not unique
- Must read file before editing
- Preserves file encoding and line endings

bash.description: Execute shell commands with timeout support
bash.details:
## Bash Tool

Execute bash commands with optional timeout.

### Capabilities
- Run any shell command
- Working directory persists between commands
- Supports background execution
- Configurable timeout (up to 10 minutes)

### Parameters
- `command` (required): The command to execute
- `timeout`: Timeout in milliseconds (default: 120000)
- `run_in_background`: Run command in background

### Notes
- Shell state (environment, etc.) does not persist
- Output truncated at 30000 characters
- Use for git, npm, docker, and other CLI tools

glob.description: Fast file pattern matching across the codebase
glob.details:
## Glob Tool

Fast file pattern matching for finding files by name patterns.

### Capabilities
- Match files using glob patterns
- Works with any codebase size
- Returns files sorted by modification time

### Parameters
- `pattern` (required): Glob pattern (e.g., "**/*.ts")
- `path`: Directory to search in (default: cwd)

### Examples
- `**/*.tsx` - All TypeScript React files
- `src/**/*.ts` - TypeScript files in src
- `*.json` - JSON files in current directory

grep.description: Search file contents using regular expressions
grep.details:
## Grep Tool

Search file contents using ripgrep-powered regex.

### Capabilities
- Full regex syntax support
- Filter by file type or glob pattern
- Multiple output modes: content, files, count
- Context lines before/after matches

### Parameters
- `pattern` (required): Regex pattern to search
- `path`: Directory to search (default: cwd)
- `glob`: Filter files by glob pattern
- `type`: Filter by file type (js, py, etc.)
- `output_mode`: "content", "files_with_matches", "count"

### Notes
- Uses ripgrep syntax (not grep)
- Supports multiline matching with `multiline: true`

webFetch.description: Fetch and analyze content from URLs
webFetch.details:
## WebFetch Tool

Fetch content from URLs and process with AI.

### Capabilities
- Fetch any public URL
- Convert HTML to markdown
- Process content with custom prompt
- 15-minute cache for repeated requests

### Parameters
- `url` (required): URL to fetch
- `prompt` (required): What to extract from the content

### Limitations
- Cannot access authenticated URLs
- HTTP URLs upgraded to HTTPS
- Results may be summarized if too large

webSearch.description: Search the web for up-to-date information
webSearch.details:
## WebSearch Tool

Search the web for current information.

### Capabilities
- Real-time web search
- Domain filtering (include/block)
- Up-to-date information beyond knowledge cutoff

### Parameters
- `query` (required): Search query
- `allowed_domains`: Only include these domains
- `blocked_domains`: Exclude these domains

### Notes
- Results include links as markdown
- Requires including sources in response

notebookEdit.details:
## NotebookEdit Tool

Edit cells in Jupyter notebooks (.ipynb files).

### Capabilities
- Replace cell contents
- Insert new cells
- Delete cells
- Support code and markdown cells

### Parameters
- `notebook_path` (required): Absolute path to notebook
- `new_source` (required): New cell content
- `cell_id`: ID of cell to edit
- `cell_type`: "code" or "markdown"
- `edit_mode`: "replace", "insert", or "delete"

task.description: Launch specialized agents for complex tasks
task.details:
## Task Tool

Launch specialized subagents for complex tasks.

### Agent Types
- **Bash**: Command execution specialist
- **Explore**: Fast codebase exploration
- **Plan**: Architecture and implementation planning
- **general-purpose**: Multi-step task handling

### Parameters
- `prompt` (required): Task description
- `subagent_type` (required): Agent type to use
- `description` (required): Short 3-5 word summary
- `run_in_background`: Run asynchronously
- `resume`: Continue previous agent session

### Notes
- Agents have access to subset of tools
- Can run multiple agents in parallel
- Background agents write to output files

askUser.description: Ask the user questions during execution
askUser.details:
## AskUserQuestion Tool

Ask the user questions to gather information or clarify requirements.

### Use Cases
- Gather user preferences
- Clarify ambiguous instructions
- Get decisions on implementation choices
- Offer choices about direction

### Parameters
- `questions` (required): Array of 1-4 questions
  - `question`: The question text
  - `header`: Short label (max 12 chars)
  - `options`: 2-4 choices with labels and descriptions
  - `multiSelect`: Allow multiple selections

### Notes
- Users can always select "Other" for custom input
- Place recommended option first with "(Recommended)"

taskCreate.description: Create structured task lists for tracking progress
taskCreate.details:
## TaskCreate Tool

Create structured task lists for complex coding sessions.

### Use Cases
- Complex multi-step tasks (3+ steps)
- Plan mode task tracking
- Multiple user tasks
- Non-trivial operations

### Parameters
- `subject` (required): Brief task title (imperative form)
- `description` (required): Detailed task description
- `activeForm`: Present continuous form for spinner

### Notes
- Tasks created with status "pending"
- Use TaskUpdate to set dependencies
- Not needed for single trivial tasks

taskUpdate.description: Update task status, details, and dependencies
taskUpdate.details:
## TaskUpdate Tool

Update existing tasks in the task list.

### Use Cases
- Mark tasks as completed
- Update task status
- Set task dependencies
- Delete obsolete tasks

### Parameters
- `taskId` (required): ID of task to update
- `status`: "pending", "in_progress", "completed", "deleted"
- `subject`: New task title
- `description`: New description
- `addBlocks`: Tasks this one blocks
- `addBlockedBy`: Tasks blocking this one

### Status Workflow
pending → in_progress → completed

taskList.description: View all tasks and their current status
taskList.details:
## TaskList Tool

List all tasks in the current session.

### Output Includes
- Task ID
- Subject (brief description)
- Status (pending, in_progress, completed)
- Owner (if assigned)
- BlockedBy (dependency IDs)

### Use Cases
- Check available tasks
- Review overall progress
- Find unblocked tasks
- After completing a task

planMode.description: Enter plan mode for designing implementation approaches
planMode.details:
## EnterPlanMode Tool

Transition to plan mode for implementation planning.

### When to Use
- New feature implementation
- Multiple valid approaches exist
- Architectural decisions needed
- Multi-file changes
- Unclear requirements

### What Happens in Plan Mode
1. Explore codebase with read-only tools
2. Understand existing patterns
3. Design implementation approach
4. Present plan for approval
5. Exit with ExitPlanMode when ready

### Skip For
- Single-line fixes
- Obvious bugs
- Clear, specific instructions

browserSnapshot.description: Get accessibility tree snapshot with element references
browserSnapshot.details:
## Browser Snapshot

Get accessibility tree snapshot with element references.

### Usage
1. Call browser_snapshot to get element refs
2. Find the target element's ref (e.g., @e2)
3. Use that ref with other browser tools
4. After page changes, call snapshot again

### Parameters
- `interactiveOnly`: Only include interactive elements (default: true)

### Output Format
```
[e1] button "Sign In"
[e2] textbox "Email" placeholder="Enter email"
[e3] link "Forgot password?"
```

browserNavigate.description: Navigate to a URL in the browser
browserNavigate.details:
## Browser Navigate

Navigate to a URL. Opens the page in the browser.

### Parameters
- `url` (required): URL to navigate to
- `waitUntil`: When to consider navigation complete (load, domcontentloaded, networkidle)

browserClick.description: Click an element on the page
browserClick.details:
## Browser Click

Click an element. Use ref from snapshot (preferred) or CSS selector.

### Parameters
- `ref`: Element reference from snapshot (e.g., @e2)
- `selector`: CSS selector (fallback)
- `dblClick`: Double click (default: false)

browserFill.description: Fill an input field with text
browserFill.details:
## Browser Fill

Fill an input field. Clears existing value first, then types the new value.

### Parameters
- `ref`: Element reference from snapshot
- `selector`: CSS selector (fallback)
- `value` (required): Value to fill in

browserType.description: Type text into the focused element
browserType.details:
## Browser Type

Type text into the currently focused element. Appends text, does not clear first.

### Parameters
- `text` (required): Text to type

browserScreenshot.description: Take a screenshot of the page or element
browserScreenshot.details:
## Browser Screenshot

Take a screenshot of the page or a specific element.

### Parameters
- `ref`: Element to screenshot (optional)
- `fullPage`: Capture full page (default: false)
- `filePath`: Save to file instead of returning base64
- `format`: png, jpeg, or webp (default: png)
- `quality`: Quality for jpeg/webp (0-100)

browserBack.details:
## Browser Back

Go back in browser history.

### Parameters
None

browserForward.details:
## Browser Forward

Go forward in browser history.

### Parameters
None

browserReload.details:
## Browser Reload

Reload the current page.

### Parameters
None

browserGetText.description: Get text content of an element
browserGetText.details:
## Browser Get Text

Get text content of an element.

### Parameters
- `ref`: Element reference from snapshot
- `selector`: CSS selector (fallback)

browserGetUrl.details:
## Browser Get URL

Get the current page URL.

### Parameters
None

browserGetTitle.details:
## Browser Get Title

Get the page title.

### Parameters
None

browserWait.description: Wait for an element, text, or URL pattern
browserWait.details:
## Browser Wait

Wait for an element, text, or URL pattern to appear.

### Parameters
- `selector`: Wait for element matching selector
- `text`: Wait for text to appear
- `url`: Wait for URL to match pattern
- `timeout`: Timeout in ms (default: 30000)

browserScroll.description: Scroll the page or element into view
browserScroll.details:
## Browser Scroll

Scroll the page or scroll an element into view.

### Parameters
- `direction`: up, down, left, right
- `amount`: Scroll amount in pixels
- `ref`: Scroll element into view
- `selector`: Scroll element into view (fallback)

browserPress.description: Press a key or key combination
browserPress.details:
## Browser Press

Press a key or key combination (e.g., 'Enter', 'Tab', 'Control+A').

### Parameters
- `key` (required): Key or combination (e.g., 'Enter', 'Control+A')

browserSelect.description: Select an option from a dropdown
browserSelect.details:
## Browser Select

Select an option from a dropdown (<select> element).

### Parameters
- `ref`: Element reference from snapshot
- `selector`: CSS selector (fallback)
- `value` (required): Option value to select

browserCheck.details:
## Browser Check

Check or uncheck a checkbox.

### Parameters
- `ref`: Element reference from snapshot
- `selector`: CSS selector (fallback)
- `checked` (required): Whether to check or uncheck

browserHover.details:
## Browser Hover

Hover over an element (useful for tooltips, dropdowns).

### Parameters
- `ref`: Element reference from snapshot
- `selector`: CSS selector (fallback)

browserDrag.description: Drag an element to another element
browserDrag.details:
## Browser Drag

Drag an element to another element.

### Parameters
- `fromRef`: Element to drag
- `fromSelector`: Element to drag (fallback)
- `toRef`: Element to drop onto
- `toSelector`: Element to drop onto (fallback)

browserDownloadImage.description: Download an image element to a file
browserDownloadImage.details:
## Browser Download Image

Download an image element to a file.

### Parameters
- `ref`: Element reference from snapshot
- `selector`: CSS selector (fallback)
- `filePath` (required): Path to save image

browserDownloadFile.description: Download a file from a URL or link
browserDownloadFile.details:
## Browser Download File

Download a file from a URL or link element.

### Parameters
- `ref`: Link element to download
- `url`: Direct URL to download
- `filePath` (required): Path to save file

browserEmulate.details:
## Browser Emulate

Emulate device settings (viewport, user agent, color scheme, geolocation).

### Parameters
- `viewport`: { width, height, isMobile, hasTouch, deviceScaleFactor }
- `userAgent`: User agent string
- `colorScheme`: light, dark, or auto
- `geolocation`: { latitude, longitude }

browserEvaluate.details:
## Browser Evaluate

Execute JavaScript code in the browser context. Returns the result.

### Parameters
- `script` (required): JavaScript code to execute

### Notes
- Returns JSON-serializable result

markArtifact.description: Mark a file as a deliverable artifact
markArtifact.details:
## Mark Artifact

Mark a file as a deliverable artifact. Use this to highlight important output files.

### Parameters
- `file_path` (required): Absolute path to the file
- `description`: Optional description of the artifact

### Use Cases
- Script-generated output files (PDF, images, documents)
- Files created with Bash
- Important files to highlight for the user

listArtifacts.description: List all marked artifacts in the session
listArtifacts.details:
## List Artifacts

List all marked artifacts in the current session.

### Parameters
None

### Returns
List of files marked as artifacts, grouped by status (created, modified, deleted)

recording.title: Record Memory
recording.disabledHint: No memory data will be recorded

enable.title: Enable Memory in Conversations
enable.description: Inject memory context into AI conversations for more personalized responses
enable.disabledHint: Memory will still be recorded, but won't be used in conversations

empty.noMemoriesHint: Memories are collected as you use the chat
empty.noSessionsHint: Sessions are created when you chat with the AI

dangerZone.title: Danger Zone
dangerZone.description: Clear all memory. This action cannot be undone.
dangerZone.confirmDescription: This will permanently delete all {{observations}} observations, {{prompts}} prompts, and {{sessions}} sessions. This action cannot be undone.
